summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic review of three hard drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019. The warrant seeks evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, and conspiracy, and specifically names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The owner of the private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, from which the electronic devices (hard drives) were seized. The investigation seeks evidence of his co-conspirators and violations of federal sex trafficking laws.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Explicitly named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence concerning her identity, location, and communications.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly names Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses, which include sex trafficking and related crimes.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search of Jeffrey Epstein's private residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, seizing three hard drives from a bookshelf cabinet.

events.title: Warrant Issued for Forensic Review
events.description: A magistrate judge issued this search warrant authorizing the forensic review of the three hard drives seized from Epstein's residence, seeking evidence for violations of federal sex trafficking laws.

events.title: Investigation Timeframe
events.description: The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to the subject offenses for the period from 1994 through August 8, 2019.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's private residence, referred to as the 'New York Residence')
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction of the issuing court)
keyFacts: The warrant authorizes the forensic examination of three specific 'Seagate Path 100' hard drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York City home on July 11, 2019.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein.
The search seeks evidence for violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking of minors), 2422, 2423, and 371 (conspiracy), covering the period from 1994 to August 8, 2019.
The types of evidence sought include communications among co-conspirators, financial records, travel documents, and photographs of victims or potential victims.
The warrant was issued under seal, and the return inventory was to be filed under seal, indicating the sensitive, ongoing nature of the investigation.
